intro: Epicion bahamense, commonly known as the Bahamian epicion, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly the Bahamas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
